messages.content: I love having 14 block wards
even just one polish turns a ward from 3 block into a defend
which usually is more efficent than generating more wards unless you have edible armor/calipers
I guess I don't usually focus as heavily on shivs
damage wise though it's just fine honestly gremlins have so much access to strength that they don't need the extra shiv damage

oh
lmao
I think that's as close as it gets to a accurate translation unfortunately English does no justice to the valiety of profanities Polish language provides
You can turn pretty much any profanity in Polish into 30 difrent nouns, adjectives and verbs which all mean vastly different things
From the simple kurwa you can make ||skurwiały, naurwiać, rozkurwiać, wkurwiać, naurwiać, rozkurwiać, nakurwiony, krzekurwiony, kurewski, kurwica, kurestwo||
That's a lot of words from a single swear

busted card. Wards and Shivs are staples of gremlin gameplay even when they are completely unboosted and this provides +2/3 to BOTH of them for the rest of the fight for just a single energy. The ward side is a bit more important as +2 block tends to matter a lot more then +2 damage but I have taken this with the intention of only using the +2 damage and had that be strong. This card can also very quickly get out of hand when you have multiple of them at once; much like silent's accuracy but on a far more potent character.  Its acutally quite rare to have  a gremlins deck that doesn't want to take this card, most of them have wards, shivs or both in high counts; which makes this pretty easily a high tier gremlins card.

If this just said "Gain 2 (3) strength and 2 (3) dexterity" it would be absolutely insane, and in the right deck, it gets pretty close to that. Sometimes even better since many cards generate more than one shiv/ward. Your main consideration when choosing to take this card should be how many cards you have that generate multiple shivs/wards, as well as how likely you are to want more of those cards. It pairs really well with any of the card spamming synergies as well, since those all have great synergy with ward and shiv generators too. I would say that at least 2/3rds of all gremlins deck end up in a spot where polish would be a pretty strong pickup. The main reason to avoid it is if you already very invested in a different form of scaling, or if your deck is getting pretty large (25 cards+) and doesn't yet mave many ward/shiv generators. 

The ward part of this is usually more important, since gremlins have such low health, being able to scale your block up is very valuable. You also just have alot of different ways to scale your damage up and quickly burst out enemies, so the shiv scaling is less impactful overall. There are also several very good cards that can generate multiple wards, like fairy dust, glitter guard, glimmer, and counter strike. In act 1, this is great into lagavulin, and can be really good into tri-sentries if you have 2 or more ward creating cards already, though it will do poorly into gremlin nob. It's very useful to have into the act 1 boss assuming you can find ward/shiv generators (there are plenty of them in the card pool, not usually an issue), and it does okay into early hallway fights. Starts to get much better once you have 4 energy and can cast it and immediately benefit by playing the right cards. Really strong against the act 2 boss, and in acts 3 and 4 as a way to go over the top with scaling, especially if you can find multiple copies of polish.

Upgrade is generally good, take it later in the run before facing a big boss. Usually I wait a little before upgrading this, to see how many ways I find to generate multiple wards/shivs, as that really changes the value of the upgrade. Great with mummified hand to more easily benefit on the same turn and spam cards, and with bolster rod to gain more strength and protect yourself on the turn you cast it.
